did.abstract: This collection of World War II memorabilia donated by Technician Third Grade, Dexter Wilcomb, contains a scrapbook maintained by Wilcomb that displays an award citation, photos, newspaper clippings, postcards , foreign currency, pressed flowers, and othre memorabalia for his time in Europe during WWII. Also in the collection are clippings from Army publications and war maps.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Dexter Wilcomb was a Technician Third Grade in the U.S. Army who fought in World War II. He belonged to the 165th Engineer Combat Battalion and recieved a Bronze Star Medal for "meritorious service in connection with military operations against an enemy of the United States during the period 15 January to 8 March 1945." Mr. Wilcomb's unit was involved in the liberation of the concentration camp at Dachau.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains newspaper clippings, publications, maps, administrative records, and a scrapbook. It includes a copy of the 1943 Biennial Report of General George C. Marshall, Chief of Staff of the United Sates Army, entitled "Victory is Certain". The scrapbook maintained by Wilcox that displays an award citation, photos, newspaper clippings, postcards , foreign currency, pressed flowers, and othe memorabalia for his time in Europe during WWII. Also in the collection are clippings from Army publications and war maps.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: [Contains military photographs of S/Sgt. Dexter H. Wilcomb (c. 1945), along with documents and clippings pertaining to Wilcomb's service. Also contains: samples of Nazi German paper money and stamps, Italo-fascist paper money, and Japanese paper money; German propaganda (Nazi SS postcards, swastikas, paper swastika flags); dried vegetation and flower samples (well preserved in cellophane); Clippings of articles and Bill Maldin cartoons about World War II soldier life.]
